body:
This is worrying.

On Fri, May 22, 2015 at 9:40 AM Nicolas Noble notifications@github.com
wrote:

> D0522 03:44:51.999410080    4816 test_config.c:52] test slowdown: machine=1.000000 build=1.000000 total=1.000000
> [==========] Running 22 tests from 1 test case.
> [----------] Global test environment set-up.
> [----------] 22 tests from End2endTest
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.SimpleRpc
> D0522 03:44:52.600553122    4816 iomgr.c:114] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed and executing final callbacks

> [       OK ] End2endTest.UnimplementedRpc (900 ms)

> [       OK ] End2endTest.RequestStreamOneRequest (1014 ms)

> D0522 03:45:00.031926688    4816 iomgr.c:114] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed and executing final callbacks
> [       OK ] End2endTest.RequestStreamTwoRequests (1015 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.ResponseStream

> [       OK ] End2endTest.ResponseStream (1100 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.BidiStream
> I0522 03:45:02.032465765    5419 end2end_test.cc:158] recv msg hello0
> I0522 03:45:02.032661692    5419 end2end_test.cc:158] recv msg hello1
> I0522 03:45:02.032809591    5419 end2end_test.cc:158] recv msg hello2
> D0522 03:45:02.132284065    4816 iomgr.c:114] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed and executing final callbacks

> [       OK ] End2endTest.DiffPackageServices (800 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.BadCredentials
> E0522 03:45:03.033322694    4816 json_token.c:106] Invalid json string
> E0522 03:45:03.033347137    4816 credentials.c:755] Invalid input for service account credentials creation
> [       OK ] End2endTest.BadCredentials (401 ms)

> [       OK ] End2endTest.ClientCancelsRpc (1100 ms)

> [       OK ] End2endTest.ServerCancelsRpc (1101 ms)

> I0522 03:45:08.636551608    5881 end2end_test.cc:158] recv msg hello1

> [       OK ] End2endTest.ClientCancelsBidi (1100 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.RpcMaxMessageSize
> D0522 03:45:09.936381928    4816 iomgr.c:114] Waiting for 2 iomgr objects to be destroyed and executing final callbacks
> [       OK ] End2endTest.RpcMaxMessageSize (1101 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.SetPerCallCredentials
> E0522 03:45:10.736659154    5933 metadata.c:564] assertion failed: ctx == elem_ctx
> FAILED: bins/dbg/end2end_test [ret=-6, pid=4816]
> 
> Seen only once so far.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722.

@jboeuf 
This also likely warrants a re-architecture of how we handle metadata in credentials.
Got that one 5 times on a 5000 run.

OK... looks like we're going to have to change something. Craig do you want
to make a proposal?

On Fri, May 22, 2015 at 12:42 PM, Nicolas Noble notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Got that one 5 times on a 5000 run.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-104751000.

I do... next week when I've got hands to write.

On Fri, May 22, 2015 at 1:01 PM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> OK... looks like we're going to have to change something. Craig do you want
> to make a proposal?

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-104754831.

what does current mean here? That it is cached and still valid?

On Wed, May 27, 2015 at 4:25 PM, Craig Tiller notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Is this function implementable?:
> 
> grpc_creds_are_current_credentials_still_current(creds, some_token_returned_with_metadata_callback)
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-106108566.

Yeah. Trying to determine if the current set of strings needs to be
refreshed or not.

My thought is to:
- remove mdctx from credentials
- pass back just a set of strings when a metadata query is made
- cache the strings as mdelems on the channel data of the auth filter
- perform a quick check before sending them out for a given request

On Wed, May 27, 2015 at 4:43 PM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> what does current mean here? That it is cached and still valid?
> 
> On Wed, May 27, 2015 at 4:25 PM, Craig Tiller notifications@github.com
> wrote:
> 
> > Is this function implementable?:
> > 
> > grpc_creds_are_current_credentials_still_current(creds,
> > some_token_returned_with_metadata_callback)
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-106108566.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-106110824.

2 thoughts.
1. Will that work with credentials attached to just a call as well?
2. why do you need a check before sending them out? The credentials has
   already done its work at this point.

On Wed, May 27, 2015 at 4:47 PM, Craig Tiller notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Yeah. Trying to determine if the current set of strings needs to be
> refreshed or not.
> 
> My thought is to:
> - remove mdctx from credentials
> - pass back just a set of strings when a metadata query is made

> - perform a quick check before sending them out for a given request

> On Wed, May 27, 2015 at 4:43 PM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> > what does current mean here? That it is cached and still valid?

> > > grpc_creds_are_current_credentials_still_current(creds,
> > > some_token_returned_with_metadata_callback)
> > > 
> > > —
> > > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > > https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-106108566.
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-106110824.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1722#issuecomment-106112356.

So for (1), I think it works just fine, except that we don't cache on the
channel.
And agreed for (2), we just need to do the quick check on subsequent
requests.

On Wed, May 27, 2015 at 4:51 PM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> 2 thoughts.

OK. As long as we do 2. outside of the credentials object (on the auth
filter for example), I'm ok with it.

The auth filter should ask the question for sure. I'm not certain whether
it should be the creds object or something it supplies that answers the
question though. Looking to you for advice.
